title: Relative grading!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
content:
Correct me if I'm wrong but isn't it supposed to be atleast 5% of the students should get S grade and less than 5-7% should fail

Isn't this the criteria? Coz last sem(sem4) except LA all the other subjects had around 13-14 marks of grace (ik coz my marks were in the border) 

Is it gonna be the same this sem as well?

comments.body: I'm not sure where/how you deduced these criteria since PES isn't transparent with their evaluation process. And PES does not have relative grading. When a batch underperforms, the grade allotments shift. There is no documented way on how much it shifts by, as far as I know.
I remember a teacher telling this in sem 1 ðŸ˜…

But yea as far as I've observed each sem has atleast 7% of S grade and less than 5% F grade and the most drastic grace marks was in last sem even higher than sem2 physics cycle I'm not exactly sure about sem3 but it had around 3-5 marks for each subject and for AFLL I'm definitely sure it was around 7 marks coz of my grade 

Tats Why i got confused when people were saying they increase it rarely
